dict.string: Unknown
The distance between your dreams and reality is called action.
Abraham Lincoln
The best way to predict the future is to create it.
George Eliot
What do we live for, if not to make life less difficult for each other?
W. Clement Stone
Aim for the moon. If you muss, you may hit a star.
Albert Einstein
Out of clutter, find simplicity. From discord, find harmony. In the middle of diffuculty lies opportunity.
Unknown
If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.
Stephen Hawking
However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
Amelia Barr
It is only in sorrow bad weater masters us; in joy we face the storm and defy it.
Walt Disney
If you can dream it, you can do it.
Joyce Meyer
You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.
J. P. Morgan
The first step towards getting somewhere is to decide that you are not going to stay where you are.
Joe Pass
If you hit a wrong note, then make it right by what you play afterwards.
George Bernard Shaw
You see things; and you say, why? But I dream things that never were; and I say why not?
Albert Einstein
Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.
Mahatma Gandhi
Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
Aristotle
You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
Jack Dempsey
A champion is someone who gets up when he can't
Margaret Mead
Never believe that a few caring people can't change the world. For, indeed, that's all who ever have.
Jimmy Wales
If there is one thing that I've learned in my career, it is to do more of what's working, and less of what's not.
Mother Teresa
Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
Unknown
Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
Unknown
Having a dream you don't pursue is like buying an ice cream cone and watching it melt all over your hand.
Ayn Rand
A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
Thomas A. Edison
Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
Vincent van Gogh
I keep on making what I can't do yet in order to learn to be able to do it.
T.S. Eliot
Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
Francis of Assisi
Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
Helen Keller
The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
Maya Angelou
Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
Audrey Hepburn
Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
John F. Kennedy
As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
Lucius Annaeus Seneca
One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
Helen Keller
Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
Walter Winchell
A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
Winston Churchill
It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
Napoleon Hill
The starting point of all achievement is desire.
George Bernard Shaw
Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
Barack Obama
Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
Steve Jobs
Things don't have to change the world to be important.
Keri Russell
Sometimes it's the smallest decisions that can change your life forever.
Hugh Prather
Just when I think I have learned the way to live, life changes.
Mason Cooley
Excuses change nothing, but make everyone feel better.
Andy Warhol
They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
Ralph Waldo Emerson
Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
Henry David Thoreau
It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
The opinion which other people have of you is their problem, not yours.
Nelson Mandela
Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
Maimonides
Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
Herbert Spencer
The great aim of education is not knowledge but action.
Oscar Wilde
Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
Bernard Meltzer
A true friend is someone who thinks that you are a good egg even though he knows that you are slightly cracked.
Winston Churchill
Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
